TCNJ Home / Explore Programs / Marketing

Marketing

Degree

BS in Business Administration (BSBA)

School

Business

Department

Marketing and Interdisciplinary Business

At a Glance

Open doors to a breadth of career opportunities as a student in TCNJ’s marketing program. Marketing is both a business orientation that considers the wants and needs of its customers to be successful and a business function responsible for generating the revenue to sustain operations. Our program equips you with the skills to successfully navigate all aspects of marketing, including selecting appropriate customers, developing a product or service to satisfy customer needs, strategizing ways of communicating with customers, and managing supply and distribution relationships.

within business administration

Marketing Minor

Professional Selling Minor

Accelerated/Dual-Degree Program Options

Get a jumpstart and enter the workforce with a master’s degree. Accelerated options get you there faster and more affordably through fewer semesters of classes. Dual degrees offer a streamlined path to earning two degrees, often with direct admission to the graduate portion.

Marketing + Accounting and Business Analytics, BSBA/MS

First-year and transfer applicants may apply to this five-year (4+1) accelerated bachelor’s to master’s program.

Marketing + Management and Organizations, BSBA/MS
First-year and transfer applicants may apply to this five-year (4+1) accelerated bachelor’s to master’s program.

You’ll Benefit From:

  • Dynamic, engaging classes in a culture of collaboration and supportive creativity
  • Focused courses designed to articulate with related academic programs at TCNJ
  • Access to cutting-edge technology and industry-grade tools and programs
  • Experiential learning through local community-based projects and internships
  • Exhibitions, student-led events, guest lectures, and on-campus employment
  • First-rate instruction and strong mentorship from accomplished faculty
  • A strong alumni network for internship and employment connections

Careers

With resumes reflecting a rigorous education and relevant experience, our recent graduates enjoy job-search success. Marketing graduates have obtained employment in a variety of organizations, including positions in advertising, digital marketing, professional sales, and supply chain management, among other fields. Marketing students also have access to the powerhouse advertising and creative centers of New York and Philadelphia.

#1 in NJ — and #1 in the nation — for high-paying jobs in marketing (among public universities)

— The Wall Street Journal/Burning Glass Institute, 2023

Internships 

Nearly all of our students complete at least one internship before graduating, a testament to the wealth of opportunity in the region and the strong support of the department. Our students have landed internships in a range of organizations and industries:

  • Business — Calvin Klein, Johnson & Johnson, L’Oréal, Target, TerraCycle
  • Finance — Merrill Lynch, Sun National Bank
  • Government and nonprofit organizations ​​— American Cancer Society, the White House
  • Media and communications — CBS Studios, NBCUniversal, Sirius XM
  • Sports and entertainment — Madison Square Garden, New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority, Trenton Thunder

Coursework

Coursework in the marketing specialization prepares students to help their organizations achieve success by considering the needs of customers in a society increasingly concerned with such complex issues as sustainability and social responsibility. Some marketing professionals strategize new products and services that improve people’s lives. Others create campaigns that build community consensus or raise awareness of policy issues or social problems. They are all creative thinkers with the ability to analyze many kinds of information and collaborate with a wide range of colleagues, from statisticians and psychologists to packaging engineers and multimedia designers.

The marketing program builds on the core business curriculum with required and elective courses in areas such as communications and advertising, international marketing, professional selling, service marketing, and consumer behavior.

Faculty Expertise

The field of marketing is broad, covering many aspects of business and touching almost all other areas of business in one way or another. TCNJ marketing faculty are experts and scholars in several diverse areas of marketing, including:

  • consumer behavior
  • digital marketing and social media
  • marketing and public policy
  • marketing communications
  • marketing research and analytics
  • marketing strategy
  • professional selling
  • service marketing

Our faculty members reflect the wide range of disciplines within marketing and interdisciplinary business, from psychologists who understand consumer behavior to lawyers who study ethics, business regulation, and public policy. These professors bring the academic insights of the scholar as well as professional experience in their fields to the classroom, tying theory to its practical application in the business world and beyond. They are also enthusiastic mentors to student researchers, whether their interest is an independent study or a student-faculty research collaboration.

Study Abroad 

Marketing majors have the opportunity to study abroad for a full semester or a shorter summer or winter term in more than 50 countries. In many cases, the tuition for foreign study is comparable to that of TCNJ. By studying abroad, students gain a better understanding of themselves and the interrelationship of business culture globally. Studying abroad also increases students’ intercultural communication skills and allows them to explore foreign businesses and government agencies, as well as cultural institutions including museums and historic sites.

Student Organizations 

Choose from numerous student organizations, with high student involvement and dedicated faculty advisors, including a chapter of the American Marketing Association (AMA).
